comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: There was a William Catton of Chicago who was a billiards champion in the 1900s, 1910s... the cue in his portrait might mean he's that guy, or kin to him?

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Plus, the photo was taken in Chicago. But if it is Wm. H. Catton ("the Rock Island Wonder")the Bain cataloger got both initials wrong. I found a reference to Marcus Catton, "son of the late Billy Catton, who won renown in foreign billiard academies. Young Catton is counted a comer by the billiard experts who have seen him play, and is expected to make a good record in the league competition". [Story out of Chicago in the Milwaukee Sentinel 12/7/14] news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1368&dat=19141207&... And here's a newspaper account from a few months later, with a photo of the 20 year old Marcus Catton, with a Rock Island, IL pedigree, that seems to be the fellow above: news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1368&dat=19150212&...

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Oh, it is the son then.  Age makes more sense too.

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks artolog, I think the photo in second newspaper looks like the same man. We will update the title with his full name.
